revised_title: Italian Chemistry: The Legacy of Piria, Cannizzaro, and Paterno
tldr: This article discusses the contributions of three Italian chemists, Piria, Cannizzaro, and Paterno, to the field of chemistry. Piria is considered the founder of one of the schools of Italian chemistry, while Cannizzaro and Paterno expanded its scope and made significant discoveries in organic, physical, and colloid chemistry. Paterno is also remembered for his work in cryoscopic studies, photochemical syntheses, and his pioneering contribution to colloid chemistry.
